p: Interferon (IFN) is a type of glycoprotein that triggers the antiviral immune response in patients infected with MERS [82]. In animal models, IFN inhibits the replication of SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV. In addition, combination therapies of IFN with other antiviral drugs have been used to treat SARS or MERS patients and show synergistic effects [69, 82].
